title: Free product of associative algebras
summary: In algebra, the free product (coproduct) of a family of associative algebras A i , i ∈ I {\displaystyle A_{i},i\in I} over a commutative ring R is the associative algebra over R that is, roughly, defined by the generators and the relations of the A i {\displaystyle A_{i}} 's. The free product of two algebras A, B is denoted by A ∗ B. The notion is a ring-theoretic analog of a free product of groups.
